oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of the Hermitage garden, Congressmen buying poppies, blimp fuel stored in New Jersey, and an ad. Nashville Tennessean, 1929 June 9.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew; Swing; LaGuardia; Bacon; Browning, Gordon; Leffingwell
Nashville Tennessean
Gasoline; Gardens; Legislators
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of the garden at the home of Andrew Jackson (the Hermitage), Congressmen (one of whom is from Tennessee) buying poppies to commemorate the first World War, ethane gas tanks (used to fuel blimps) being stored in Lakehurst, New Jersey (where the Hindenburg disaster would occur in 1937), and an ad. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wiles
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
